body:
### Problem

`vim.treesitter.foldexpr()` explodes with error message `invalid top` under some circumstances (in my testing, seems to happen only with `'foldminlines'` set to `0`).

```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:257: invalid top
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function '_foldupdate'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:257: in function 'do_foldupdate'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:239: in function 'foldupdate'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:377: in function 'callback'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:193: in function 'cb'
        ...1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:478: in function '_run_async_callbacks'
        ...1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:534: in function 'parse'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:90: in function 'compute_folds_levels'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:376: in function 'fn'
        ...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:275: in function <...m/0.11.1/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:271>
```

Additionally, because the foldexpr schedules async callbacks, it's not possible to work around this by creating a custom `'foldexpr'` that wraps the call to `vim.treesitter.foldexpr()` in a `pcall()`.

### Steps to reproduce

Write this `minimal.lua` to disk:

```
vim.opt.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'
vim.opt.foldmethod = 'expr'
vim.opt.foldminlines = 0 -- Allow closing even 1-line folds.
```

Create a 1-line file, `example.md`:

```
echo hello > example.md
```

Open Neovim (v0.11.1) with:

```
nvim --clean -u minimal.lua example.md
```

Enter insert mode with `o`.

Exit insert mode with `<Esc>`.

Press `dd` to delete the empty line that was just added

Observe `invalid top` error message, coming from [here in `lua/stdlib.c`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/v0.11.1/src/nvim/lua/stdlib.c#L568-L570).

### Expected behavior

No error should be thrown.

These async callbacks scheduled from `vim.treesitter.foldexpr()` seem hard to isolate from failure (state changes between scheduling and execution), so maybe we should consider adding a `pcall()` internally? See this different issue (about dying with `invalid bot` instead of `invalid bot`), which is a totally different kind of failure and cause, but which shares the same difficulty of not being easy to work around:

- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32551

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.1 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1744318430

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not tested

### Operating system/version

macOS 15.4.1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.41.1

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

Homebrew

comment_data.body: can't repro on latest master, can you? there may have been in a fix in 0.11.3 (though I didn't test), which was released today, changelog: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/b2684d9f6658544d75e2431a06bcf21fe80673f8

The above recipe still repros for me on the just released v0.11.3.

I just tried with a build of current `HEAD` of `master` (444a8b3ec6) and found some mixed results.

- On the first build, I did `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo` and ran it directly out of the `build/` directory, and it _did not_ repro.
- To be doubly sure that this was legit, I repeated the build: `make clean`, `make distclean`, and `rm -rf build`,and then rebuilt with `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release` followed by `sudo make install`, and this time I ran it from `/usr/local/bin/` and it _did_ repro.
